for_sales.sales_text:
New Blossom Class, designed by John Leather, built 1966, by Browns of Rowhedge. Clinker gaffer-larch on oak. Lovely day/weekend sailing-with  lifting galvanised steel centre plate, great for tidal rivers and muddy creeks..

Registered Small Ships registration.MCA

Dimensions 19ft 6’ by 7 ft (22ft with bowsprit) Draft 2ft 6’ plate up   5ft plate down. Cabin for 2, marine upholstery. Engine Volvo penta MB2 50S( at present unserviced) Outboard bracket and barely used outboard-bought new Tohatsu Spruce mast ,gaff rig Mainsail,staysail,& jib -all in working condition

Tidebird has been regularly maintained and routine repairs carried out during our lengthy ownership, including stripping hull back to bare wood and repainting in full. She is under cover and in a ventilated yard shelter, having been ashore for some time due to family/health matters. Some seasonal maintainance /repairs will be required, but this is very much a reluctant sale due to necessity, rather than choice. She is a very sturdy well built craft, with good sailing qualities-and has been a huge pleasure to look after and sail.

Contact H Kemp/B Chapple 01394 411220/mobile 07762326194

boat.full_description: The New Blossom Class were originally built as open boats with cabin added if requested, so they have no room re heads or galley, just upholstery re 2 single bunks and a shelf for camping stove/mugs etc . Very practical stowage.
boat.name: Tidebird
boat.short_description: Tidebird is a New Blossom Class yacht designed by John Leather.
